availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William B. Baker (Trigg County farmer and merchant)

body.p: Trigg County farmer and merchant. Kentucky native. Married Mildred J. Baker. Father of Hart Baker, Mary J. Baker, Henry Baker, Ada Baker, and Blake Baker. Held four slaves in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2, p. 357. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 67. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 17. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Canton, p. 21. Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registrations, 1863-1865, Ancestry, Kentucky, First Congressional District, Trigg County, 1863, p. 2. Kentucky Birth, Marriage, and Death Records, 1852-1910, Ancestry, Deaths, Trigg County, 1875.
